history.content:
Taking 104 as your first upper-div should be fine, since 110 is not a prereq for that class. The core math upper division courses tend to be pretty independent of one another (except for 185, which assumes 104). 

Can attest that 104 (for me) was the harder class. However, assuming that you took CS 70, you will be well-prepared for 104 :)

I am considering a minor in mathematics. On the department's website, it recommends students take Math 110 before Math 104, since the latter is stated as "more demanding" course. My problem is, Math 110 lectures take place at the same time as 61C Lectures, and I prefer to attend my lectures in person as opposed to watching the webcast.

As such, would it be better to take Math 110 and watch the 61C lectures at another time, or would it be ok to take Math 104 as my first upper division mathematics course?

Any help is appreciated, thanks in advance.
history.subject: Math 104 vs Math 110
